Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content: Daniel‚Äôs the best media officer we‚Äôve ever had. I should know, I was the first one and I was terrible :3

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content:
Hey, I play rhythm games a lot myself. My favorite is Beat Mania series, although, to be honest, I‚Äôve never played Beat Mania. There is a Korean game called EZ2DJ, and they are very similar, and Konami actually sued the Korean company, so they can‚Äôt make EZ2DJ anymore. Anyway, EZ2DJ is the one I played a lot. It‚Äôs focused more on the 5-key mode, while Beat Mania mostly uses 7-key mode, and EZ2DJ has pedal, which is, or was, totally new. After suing the Korean company, Konami decided to put pedals on Beat Mania. Those bastards‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt see why they aren‚Äôt suing Guitar Hero and Rock Band, which are just complete rip off of Konami‚Äôs Guitar Freaks and Drum Mania (and now Keyboard Mania since Rock Band 3).

Sadly, I haven‚Äôt played anything Beat Mania style, so I got quite bad. But I started playing new rhythm game called osu! (all lower case with ! at the end) and it‚Äôs pretty good. It‚Äôs basically Elite Beat Agent but people can make ‚Äúmaps‚Äù which are musics. It also has two special mode, which include Taiko mode, and since it‚Äôs from Konami, it may be sued soon. I hope not, though‚Ä¶.

Replies.Author: DdR_Daniel
Replies.Content: I used to play osu! a lot but haven‚Äôt played it in a long time now‚Ä¶ I have Beatmania for PS2 but no Beatmania controller, but Mr. Biggs in Colorado Springs has a nice Beatmania machine and I play that occasionally. And then DDR, Stepmania, Pump-it-Up, a little DJ Hero and I‚Äôm okay at Guitar Hero. I‚Äôve never heard of EZ2DJ though.

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content:
There‚Äôs a funny story I have at Mr. Biggs in Colorado Springs. That‚Äôs where my high school had after prom, and it was first time I‚Äôve ever been there. With my friend, I played Time Crisis 4 and spend all my money there, then I said, ‚ÄúI wish they had Beat Mania here‚Äù then he‚Äôs like, ‚ÄúThey do, dude.‚Äù I was so sad that I had no money left‚Ä¶

And I‚Äôm not surprised that you never heard of EZ2DJ. I don‚Äôt think it was released outside of Korea. When I saw Pump-it-Up at DnB, and it was the same version I used to play when I was in elementary school in Korea, I hoped that EZ2DJ was there too, but it wasn‚Äôt.

If I make enough money, I think I‚Äôm gonna buy one for my personal use. Wouldn‚Äôt that be awesome!

Replies.Author: DdR_Daniel
Replies.Content: You didn‚Äôt graduate from Liberty, did you? The year before my senior year, the after prom was held at Mr. Biggs, but when I was a senior it was just at the school.

Replies.Author: Chaeha
Replies.Content: You graduated from Liberty? Man, it was, like, few blocks away from my house, but since I needed (or they decided that I needed) ESL, so I went to Rampart. And today (or yesterday since it‚Äôs 12:13 right now) I went to see Rampart marching band competition, I also saw Liberty marching band. They were good, and certainly whole lot better than when I was in high school. It‚Äôs cool you went to Liberty.

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content: It would be more awesome if the club got to use it too üòÑ

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
Yo, Daniel! I‚Äôm Grant, and needless to say I don‚Äôt really do anything important, but I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôve chatted in person before, so here I am.

Firstly, much respect to you for being more awesome than me at pretty much everything. I‚Äôm rather horrible at mathematics and it just goes without saying that I can‚Äôt play rhythm games as well as you‚Ä¶ I have played a handful, though, including osu! and some Rock Band (even though I know this rather pales in difficulty when compared to, say, ANY OTHER RHYTHM GAME EVER) and DJ Hero.

I used to own DDRMax2 for the PS2, but I never got beyond Light difficulty for that. Would be fun to get back into it, but hey. I also still have to try both BeatMania and Stepmania still, bahh. You can tell I‚Äôm not too on the up-and-up with these things.

Anyway, good to sort-of make your acquaintance, Daniel. I‚Äôve definitely been hearing a lot about your video game badassery lately, so. üôÇ

Replies.Author: Chris Lee
Replies.Content:
Hi Daniel! It‚Äôs Chris, that asian kid that bothers you on occasion üòõ I‚Äôm mostly commenting to just say that you kick ass at video games, multitasking, math, and life in general. I love rhythm games myself; I used to play Guitar Hero/Rock Band pretty regularly, and I‚Äôve dabbled in Stepmania. I occasionally visit a site called JamLegend, which is like a Guitar Hero-esque game for the keyboard. I‚Äôm thinking of tracking down Beatmania and graduating to seven buttons, heh.

Keep kicking ass, man. I mean, uh, the _media officer_ sir.
